thread.title: New line for Canadian power to NE wins support in Vermont -
thread.title_full: New line for Canadian power to NE wins support in Vermont - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: New line for Canadian power to NE wins support in Vermont -
text:
MONTPELIER, Vt. (AP) - A plan to run a 1,000-megawatt power line down Lake Champlain and across Vermont to bring Canadian power to southern New England is getting key support in the Green Mountain State.
Vermont state officials and TDI New England CEO Donald Jessome say the company has reached agreements with four state agencies, three towns and the state's largest power company, Green Mountain Power.
Jessome says the company expects to clear three final hurdles - including a presidential permit for the international energy deal and approval by the Vermont Public Service Board - by the end of the year.
The $1.2 billion project is expected to be moving power by mid-2019. It's one of at least four projects in various stages of planning to bring more Canadian power to New England.
